channel.title: Social Networking on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Social Networking on 0x000216

item.title: Poken Enhances Face to Face Social Networking
item.description: Is jotting down contact information on scraps of paper your go-to method? Do you find yourself hoping your hand-written notes survive the journey home? Perhaps you rely on traditional business cards? Let’s face it, those methods are outdated. Just like Facebook, MySpace, LinkedIn, and Twitter revolutionized online networking, Poken is ushering in a new era for in-person connections with a device aptly named “Poken.” Think of it as a modern-day amulet, powered by cutting-edge technology.

item.title: BlackBerry Torch Fires Up Mobile Business
item.description: The BlackBerry Torch symbolizes a new era in mobile business communication, much like the Olympic torch marks the start of the Games. This smartphone combines a touch screen with a slide-out QWERTY keyboard and introduces the BlackBerry 6 operating system. BlackBerry highlights the new OS’s ability to aggregate social media and RSS feeds, enable faster web browsing with multiple open tabs, provide universal search functionality, offer enhanced multimedia with a YouTube app, and ensure easy setup and personalization with a user-friendly design.

item.title: Do You Have A Poken Card?
item.description: The internet has revolutionized the business world. Job seekers now heavily rely on online platforms, while businesses prioritize their online presence through websites and social media channels like Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn. Embracing these technological advancements is crucial in today’s digital age. So, are you up-to-date with the latest trend, Poken cards? While electronic business cards are gaining traction faster in Europe than in the US, their adoption is inevitable. Poken, a Swiss company, is leading this transformation with its innovative technology and comprehensive support system.

item.title: Widgets for Charity
item.description: The holiday season is a time for giving, and this year, technology is making it easier than ever to support causes we care about. “America’s Giving Challenge,” a contest using “charity badges,” harnesses the power of social networks and the internet to raise money for charities. The contest is backed by Kevin Bacon, who is known for his association with the “six degrees of separation” concept. His website, SixDegrees.org, supports celebrity charities and promotes the Charity Badge.

item.title: Year of the Tiger Poken
item.description: February 14th was a significant date, marking not only Valentine’s Day but also the beginning of the Chinese New Year. In the Chinese Zodiac, a 12-animal cycle is used to name the years, including the tiger. The year 2010 is designated as the “Year of the Tiger”. Beyond its association with the tiger, 2010 is poised to be recognized as the “Year of the Poken”. Introduced late last year, the Poken, a social networking device originating in Switzerland, has gained popularity in America.

item.title: Pink Android Intercept Means Business
item.description: The Samsung Intercept, with its stylish satin pink exterior, could easily be described as “Pretty in Pink,” much like the classic 80s movie. This phone is more than just attractive; it’s also a highly capable device. This pink Android phone boasts a large 3-inch touchscreen display, providing access to a vast library of apps from the Android Market. What sets it apart from other touchscreen phones is its full slide-out QWERTY keyboard, enabling swift emailing, instant messaging, and texting.

item.title: Going Incognito With SANYO and Sprint
item.description: When you need a phone for discreet texting, the SANYO Incognito from Sprint is the perfect choice. Its sleek, minimalist design resembles a small, black monolith. Don’t be fooled by its understated appearance, though, as this phone is packed with features. The mirrored shell conceals a monochrome display and essential buttons for making calls. Open the SANYO Incognito to reveal a full QWERTY keyboard with generously sized keys, perfect for rapid texting.

item.title: WiFi in a Memory Card
item.description: You don’t often see an SD memory card with an FCC ID, but this one is special. It’s not just a 2GB memory card; it’s also a WiFi transmitter. Set it up on your computer with the included USB adapter, then put it in your camera. Now, whenever you’re within range of your home network, your pictures will automatically upload to your computer or your favorite online photo sharing site. It’s like magic!

item.title: Business Cards Go Green With Poken
item.description: Wonderful, wonderful Copenhagen. It seems like it’s going to sink underwater as the ocean gets warmer and terrible storms rage on. All this is happening while people still doubt climate change and don’t believe we can reduce CO2 levels to 350 ppm. The climate change summit starting this week in Copenhagen, Denmark, has gotten me thinking. I’m hopeful despite the doubters and cynics who believe that getting CO2 levels down to 350 ppm is as impossible as ending our addiction to sugary drinks.

item.title: Your Ally In The Android vs iPhone Battle
item.description: LG’s initial Android offering, the LG Ally for Verizon Wireless, is a remarkable device. It boasts a range of features and access to a vast library of apps on the Android Market. If you prioritize texting and email, you’ll appreciate the tactile feedback of real keys. The LG Ally features a 3.2-inch touchscreen and a slide-out QWERTY keyboard with well-sized keys. With five customizable home screens, you can personalize it with numerous Android apps.

item.title: HTC Aria Social Networking Smartphone
item.description: If you’re looking for a way to stay connected, forget dogs – get FriendStream! This service lets you interact with friends through Facebook, Twitter, and Flickr, all from the HTC Aria, a cutting-edge Android smartphone. The Aria boasts a sleek, seamless design crafted from a single piece of black aluminum. It’s compact enough for your pocket yet powerful enough for work and play. Its sizable 3.2-inch touchscreen features pinch-to-zoom functionality, automatically adjusting text size for comfortable website browsing.

item.title: Customer Service Using Clouds and Social Networks
item.description: Exceptional customer service is crucial for any successful business. Retaining customers is more cost-effective than acquiring new ones, and positive customer experiences lead to organic promotion. Conversely, unhappy customers can significantly damage a company’s reputation, especially in today’s age of social media. Prioritizing excellent customer service brings rewards, while neglecting it leads to negative consequences. Implementing an efficient and user-friendly system that integrates modern communication channels like social media with traditional methods such as email and phone support is key.

item.title: Five Years Of The Explainer
item.description: T1 Rex’s Business Telecom Explainer turned five this month, with more than 800 posts published since its 2004 launch. Our initial goal was to clarify complex telecommunications services and provide businesses with competitive options. Over time, we’ve broadened our scope to encompass a wide range of products, services, and topics relevant to our audience. As we approach our second decade, let’s examine the “aughts” and explore potential future trends. This explainer blog, as the name suggests, was launched alongside T1Rex.

item.title: Santa Is Real And Here’s The Proof
item.description: Listen up, skeptics! There’s visual evidence that Santa, the Easter Bunny, Tooth Fairy, and Cupid are real and have visited your home. They’ve been caught on camera at your house! Don’t believe the naysayers, trust the evidence of your own eyes. This photographic proof comes from CatchACharacter, a company that specializes in capturing images of fictional characters in action. They cater to kids who need visual confirmation to believe. While some of us were content with the stories and the treats that came with them, kids today require more tangible proof.
